0.2.7.6: - *Size Increase:* The minimap has been significantly enlarged (approximately doubled in size) for better visibility and detail.
- *Toggle Functionality:* The minimap can now be shown or hidden using a new integrated toggle button.
- *UI Integration:* The toggle button is styled as a sleek bar at the top of the minimap, effectively replacing the previous thick padding border for a cleaner look.
- *Cleaner Look:* Internal padding within the minimap canvas has been reduced, allowing drawn content to extend closer to its edges and the new toggle button.
0.2.7.5: - Made some improvements to the minimap.
0.2.7.4: - Implemented **Markdown** support for displaying patch notes using the `marked.js` library.
- Notes can now include *italics*, **bold text**, lists, and other Markdown features for improved readability.
0.2.7.3: - Dynamic Minimap Zoom: The minimap now dynamically zooms relative to the main map's zoom level, offering a more detailed local overview when zoomed in.
- Minimap Centering: The minimap's view now centers on the main map's current viewport.
- Resolved UI Overlap: Fixed an issue where the Settings panel would overlap the minimap when opened.
- Restored Drawing Functions: Corrected main map drawing functions to resolve a black screen issue from a previous development error.
- Improved Initial Zoom: Adjusted the 'Fit' zoom level to ensure better map visibility on load.
- Improved minimap scale calculation and added further guards against invalid numeric states.
0.2.7.0: - A new minimap is now available in the top-right corner, providing an overview of the entire game world.
- Key structures (King's Castle, Fortresses) and Biome regions are displayed on the minimap.
- A white rectangle on the minimap indicates your current viewport on the main map.
- *Click to Pan:* Clicking on the minimap will instantly pan the main map to that location.
- The 'Go To' coordinate search has been moved to the top of the left-side panel.
- Display toggles, Performance settings, and Info/Stats are now consolidated into a new collapsible '‚öôÔ∏è Settings' panel in the top-right.

- Minor performance improvement by caching the 'Tile Detail' threshold.
- Consolidated some internal filtering logic for building visibility.
- Corrected a minor HTML class name typo in the patch notes modal footer.
0.2.6.2: - Made a few tweaks to adjust zooming feel and responsiveness.
0.2.6.1: - Attempted to fix an issue with the statistics panel not updating correctly.
0.2.6.0: - Completed a major internal code refactor for improved long-term stability and easier future updates.
- Added a 'ping' effect: selections now flash briefly to make them easier to locate on the map.
- The settings panel in the top-right has been reorganized with headers for better clarity.
- Fixed a minor performance issue where buildings were being drawn twice.
0.2.5.12: - Added a new 'Always Show RSS' toggle for Alliance RSS buildings.
- When enabled, this new option will keep Alliance RSS buildings visible on the map at all zoom levels.
- Fixed a rendering bug that was causing buildings to be drawn twice in high-detail view.
0.2.5.11: - Fixed a critical bug where Alliance RSS buildings were not filling their entire 2x2 area, leaving parts of the tile uncolored.
- Refactored the building rendering logic to be more efficient and prevent similar bugs in the future.
0.2.5.10: - Fixed a bug where Alliance RSS buildings were rendered as 1x1 tiles instead of the correct 2x2 size.
- Fixed an issue where the names of Alliance RSS buildings (e.g., 'Wood', 'Food') were not being displayed on the map.
0.2.5.9: - Added a new toggleable layer for 'Alliance RSS' buildings.
- Alliance resource nodes (Wood, Food, Stone, Iron) will now render on the map with unique colors.
- A new 'Show Alliance RSS' checkbox has been added to the top-right panel to control their visibility.
0.2.5.8: - Replaced the confusing 'Quality' dropdown with two separate, clearer settings:
- New *'Tile Detail'* setting now controls only when tiles merge together at low zoom levels.
- New *'Show Gridlines'* checkbox gives users direct control over gridline visibility for a major performance boost.
0.2.5.7: - Added a 'Quality' dropdown menu in the top-right panel.
- Users can now choose their preferred performance vs. visual quality setting.
- Settings include: _Low_, _Normal_, _High_, and _Ultra (No Merging)_ to accommodate a wide range of devices.
- The selected quality setting is saved and remembered for your next visit.
0.2.5.5: - Made improvements to the zoom camera behavior.
0.2.5.4: - Changed the color palette of existing buildings.
0.2.5.3: - Fixed the patch notes not showing and updating correctly.
0.2.5.2: - Improved the vertical zoom slider for better precision and a more consistent layout on different screen sizes.
- Optimized application startup by moving patch notes to an external file.
0.2.5.1: - Redesigned UI layout for improved usability.
- Added a vertical zoom slider on the left.
- Implemented a configurable display for tile coordinates.
- Fixed building name text overflowing its container.
- Added this patch notes window and versioning system.
0.2.5.0: - Initial public release version with core features.
